Class ThrowerUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.util.ThrowerUtil

  • public class ThrowerUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Methods and constants that are used for throwing rings

    • Method Detail

      • getVi

        public static double getVi(double x1,
                           double y1,
                           double x2,
                           double y2,
                           double angle)
        Parameters:
        x1 - where the robot starts (typically 0)
        y1 - initial height of the ring when it is launched
        x2 - distance from ring thrower to goal
        y2 - height of goal
        angle - angle of the ring thrower
        Returns:
        theoretical velocity that an object needs to achieve to reach the requirements set in the parameters.

      • getTargetY

        public static double getTargetY(com.acmerobotics.roadrunner.geometry.Pose2d currentPos,
                                double targetX)
        Parameters:
        currentPos - starting location (x1, y1, and heading)
        targetX - an x value (x2)
        Returns:
        Assuming connecting points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) make a line and the heading is known, return y2

      • getTargetX

        public static double getTargetX(com.acmerobotics.roadrunner.geometry.Pose2d currentPos,
                                double targetY)
        Parameters:
        currentPos - starting location (x1, y1, and heading)
        targetY - an x value (y2)
        Returns:
        Assuming connecting points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) make a line and the heading is known, return x2

      • isValidAngle

        public static boolean isValidAngle(double x,
                                   double y,
                                   double angle)
        Parameters:
        x - robot X position
        y - robot Y position
        angle - robot heading (must be in radians)
        Returns:
        if the robot is facing the goal.
